titles.title: Alaska Railroad Right of Way Extension Act of 2011
A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to convey a railroad right of way between North Pole, Alaska, and Delta Junction, Alaska, to the Alaska Railroad Corporation.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

bill.summary: 3/17/2011--Introduced. Alaska Railroad Right of Way Extension Act of 2011 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior, and other appropriate federal officials, to convey to the Alaska Railroad Corporation all rights, title, and interests of the United States to certain land located between North Pole, Alaska, and Delta Junction, Alaska, for the purpose of constructing a railroad corridor extension and related support areas and structures. Requires Surface Transportation Board approval for the phased construction of such extension.
